p: PCA analysis of volatile profiles was able to distinguish fourteen Citrus varieties as tolerant and moderately tolerant from those susceptible to Candidatus Liberibacter asiaticus (CLas). Tolerant and moderately tolerant cultivars showed higher amounts of volatiles than susceptible varieties. These compounds include aldehydes (undecanal, neral, geranial, and citronellal) and some monoterpenes such as linalool (0.1–68.3%), d-limonene (0.3–55.3%), myrcene (0.1–8.5%), α- (0.2–3.1%) and β-phellandrene (0.1–11.4%) [ 81].
